    • Constructor Detail

      • SalesReport

        public SalesReport()

    • Method Detail

      • operation

        public void operation​(StaffList staff)
        List down the types of report for selection. (Today, Monthly, Yearly) Only Manager role is able to view reports. Other roles such as Chef and Waiter unable to view it hence generate unauthorized error message. After validating role, prompt user to enter the period he/she want to view the sales report from and to. Then pass startDate, endDate and staff to printReport().
        Parameters:
        staff - contains the list of staff to get the staff's id and staff's name.

      • printReport

        public void printReport​(java.util.Date startDate,
                        java.util.Date endDate,
                        StaffList staff)
        Print various type of report based on user selection in operation() Daily report will only contains current date sales. E.g. current date is 12/04/2019. All sales made on this day will be printed out with following details: time, invoice no., ordered items, total price of each order, staff name who created the order. Ending it with total revenue made and No of transaction. Similarly for Monthly and Annual reports. Just that it has an additional column called date.
        Parameters:
        startDate - start period of the report
        endDate - end period of the report, if null means the report printed will be for the day itself.
        staff - This contains the list of staff to get the staff's id and staff's name.

      • readSerializedObject

        public static java.util.List readSerializedObject​(java.lang.String filename)
        It will read the filename and deserialized the file into the object class. catch FileNotFoundException - return null if file is not found catch IOException - print error message catch ClassNotFoundException- print error message
        Parameters:
        filename - contains order record
        Returns:
        pDetails This is an List which will be return when the file is read/deserialized successfully

      • writeSerializedObject

        public static void writeSerializedObject​(java.lang.String filename,
                                         java.util.List list)
        This will take in the List to be Serialized The Serialized name will be the param filename
        Parameters:
        filename - the filename of the SerializedObject
        list - the ArrayList to be Serialized
